description: From the past participle stem of Latin fellāre  +‎ -ory.

adjectives.description: fellatory (comparative more fellatory, superlative most fellatory)

examples: Fame, however, came with Deep Throat, since when her name has become synonymous with a fellatory technique that looks, to the cold eye, uncommonly like a sublimation of a suppressed castratory urge of immense proportions.
